title: (x) AIA New York - (similar to) Agency Gothic {Minimalista}
content:
Hi,   
   
I left my font book at home and am having trouble identifying this typeface. Any suggestions? Thanks, I appreciate it.   
   
 ![AIA poster](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121093724im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/49448.jpg)

 [‹ Opodo Logo](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121093724/http:/www.typophile.com/node/6781 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Yosemite Pale Ale beer label - Palatino {Chesh} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121093724/http:/www.typophile.com/node/6780 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Corey Holms

comments.content: I don't think this is a font. Think about it: How hard would it have been for the designer of this poster to draw one letter (really) that looks like one of the WTC towers versus finding a typeface that just _happened_ to have an A that looked that way already? I would bet on the former.
What you say makes PERFECT sense, but was not what I was hoping to hear. Thanks for confirming my suspicions Mark.

On the other hand, Font Bureau's [Armada](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121093724/http:/www.fontbureau.com/fonts/font_frames.tpl?cart=10958154481242636&fontname=Armada) does have an A that is close to the proportions (except the top is curved, instead of flat with chamfered corners). Light Compressed, I think.

It looks like a condensed version of Agency Gothic:   
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/castletype/agency-gothic-ct/agency-gothic-bold/](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121093724/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/castletype/agency-gothic-ct/agency-gothic-bold/)
